ARABIC: لَّٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He is, however, Allah, my Lord, and I will not associate anyone with my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And He is God, my Lord, and I do not associate any one with my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for myself, Allah alone is my Lord, and I associate none with my Lord in His Divinity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I believe that He is God my Lord and I do not consider anything equal to Him."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “But I just say that only Allah is my Lord, and I do not ascribe anyone as a partner to my Lord.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But as for my part, (I believe) that He is Allah, my Lord, and none shall I associate as partner with my Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But as for me, He, Allah, is my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But lo, He is God, my Lord, and I will not associate with my Lord any one.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But He is Allah, my Lord, and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But as far as I am concerned, God alone is my Lord and I set up no partners with Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: But he is Allah, my Lord; and with my Lord associate not anyone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But I [say], ‘‘He is Allah, my Lord,’’ and I do not ascribe any partner to my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But (I think) for my part that He is Allah, My Lord, and none shall I associate with my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But as for my part (I believe) that He is Allah, my Lord and none shall I associate as partner with my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He is Allah, my Lord, and I will not associate anyone with My Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But as for me, He is God, my Lord, and I never associate with my Lord anyone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:38] But lo (lākinnā is actually [made up of] lākin anā, ‘but I … ’, where the hamza vowel has [either] been transferred onto the nūn [of lākin], or omitted [altogether] with the nūn assimilated with the like of it) He [is] (huwa, this is the pronoun of the [subject] matter [to be stated] and is clarified by the sentence that follows it: the meaning [in other words] is ‘[But, it is that] I say that [He is]’) God, my Lord, and I do not ascribe any partner to my Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But) I say (He is Allah, my Lord) my Creator and Provider, (and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner) among idols.
